Schedule¶

class sknet.optimize.schedule.constant(lr)[source]¶

constant learning rate. This case is the most basic learning rate update policy agnostic of the current epoch and the current performances. Unless used with an optimizer with internal gradient normalization such as Adam, a constant learning is in general sub-optimal. For convex optimization problems, convergence is only guaranteed with a decaying learning rate.

__init__(lr)[source]¶

Initialize the class with a learning rate

Parameters:lr (scalar) – learning rate to use
__weakref__[source]¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

reset()[source]¶

Reset the list of learning rates

update(valid_accu, epoch, **kwargs)[source]¶

Update the value of the learning rate, in this case, stay the same

class sknet.optimize.schedule.linear(lr, step)[source]¶

Linearly changing learning rate. This method allows to linearly change the learning rate initialized as \(lr\). It is done by using a given scalar \(s\) when calling the update() method and setting the new learning rate to be \(lr-s*\kappa\) with \(\kappa\) a step given at initialization.

reset()[source]¶

Reset the class

class sknet.optimize.schedule.exponential(init_lr, step)[source]¶

exponential decay of the learning rate. This method allows to exponentially change the learning rate initialized as \(lr\). It is done by using a given scalar \(s\) when calling the update() method and setting the new learning rate to be \(lr-\kappa^s\) with \(\kappa\) a step given at initialization.

reset()[source]¶

reset the class

class sknet.optimize.schedule.stepwise(dict_lr)[source]¶

stepwise learning rate strategy. This method allows to have stepwise learning rate It is done by using a given dictionnary containing the epochs at which the learning rate changes (starting at 0).

Example of use:

stepwise({0:0.1,50:0.01,100:0.0005})
reset()[source]¶

Reset the class

class sknet.optimize.schedule.adaptive(lr, step, decay_type='exponential', patience=5, metric_name='valid_accuracy', lookback=10)[source]¶

adaptive learning rate strategy. This method allows to have an adaptive learning rate with behavior depending on a given metric performance. if the performance stagnates from more than patience iterations then the learning rate is transformed (linearly or exponentiall) by mean of a step parameter

reset()[source]¶

Reset the class
